content.question:
<math alttext="C o, open parenthesis, H 2 O, close parenthesis, 6, with a positive 2 charge aqueous pink plus 4 C l with a negative 1 charge aqueous is in equilibrium with C o C l 4 with a negative 2 charge aqueous blue plus 6 H 2 O liquid; delta H is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Co</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>pink</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext> </mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext> </mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>⇄</mo></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext> </mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtable><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CoCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>blue</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext> </mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mn>6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext> </mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable><mtable><mtr><mtd><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="2.0em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext> </mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
A student poured <math alttext="10 milliliters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="C o C l 2 aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CoCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> into a test tube and added a few drops of concentrated <math alttext="H C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, which resulted in a deep-blue solution. The reaction that occurred is represented by the chemical equation shown above. Then, the student placed the test tube inside a beaker that contained ice and water for about five minutes. Which of the following describes what the student most likely observed next, and why?

choices.label: The color of the solution changed from blue to pink, because lowering the temperature increased the collision frequency between <math alttext="C o C l 4 with a negative 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CoCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H 2 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The color of the solution changed from blue to pink, because cooling caused the equilibrium to shift to form the pink-colored <math alttext="C o, open parenthesis, H 2 O, close parenthesis, 6, with a positive 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Co</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The color of the solution did not change, because more water was not added to the solution.
The color of the solution did not change, because heat is not released from this reaction.

content.answer: The color of the solution changed from blue to pink, because cooling caused the equilibrium to shift to form the pink-colored <math alttext="C o, open parenthesis, H 2 O, close parenthesis, 6, with a positive 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Co</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 6.F: Explain the connection between experimental results and chemical concepts, processes, or theories.
